intro: Cylindrolobus uninodus, commonly known as the slender globular liverwort, is a member of the family Porellaceae. It is a small, terrestrial liverwort that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive thalloid structure with a cylindrical, lobed thallus that is usually green or reddish in color. Its reproductive structures, including both male and female gametophores, are closely clustered on the thallus. Cylindrolobus uninodus is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat.
